@frankvallecillo
Not quite right. The activator runs automatically each time the machine boots and every 24 hours thereafter while the machine is up. Each time it runs, it resets the activation grace time to 180 days. Providing the app and scheduled task remain unharmed, you only ever need to run the activator once.

Thanks so much! I actually had a copy of 2010 Pro Plus from a university, but it was always loudly complaining because it couldn't connect to the university's license server. This solved all my problems, and is definitely easier to use than TheThingy's activators.

I got a problem, this thing installed great. I had history with this neat toolkit. I really like it. However, couple months back my antivirus detected "autokms.exe" as a virus and either removed it or quarantined it. So, being a noob I removed it thinking office would still be activated. Well shortly after, office said I had a fake key and was not able to use it. So after some time I uninstalled it, reinstalled it and now doing it again.. any way I can keep this toolkit to do its job whilst having my antivirus active? there's no way I can keep my virus scanner inactive for life... help appreciated.
